metadata.dc:author: Rivas De Andrés, Juan José
Martínez Vallina, Primitivo
Menal Muñóz, Patricia
Ramírez Gil, Maria Elena
Hernández Ferrández, Jorge
Muñoz Gonzalez, Guillermo
metadata.dc:description: The most frequent location for non-metastatic germ cell tumors is the anterior mediastinum. Primary lung germ cell tumors are an exception in medical literature being limited to just a few cases of choriocarcinomas and rare cases of yolk-sac tumors. In this paper, we report a case of a pulmonary yolk-sac tumor with atypical characteristic as regards its diagnosis and treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Pulmonary pure yolk-sac tumor. A rare anatomopathological entity.
